messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: We are Noble School of Higher Learning. Noble has been our business name for a few things now for years. We like it so we stick with it on all counts. It s a
messages.messageBody:
We are Noble School of Higher Learning. Noble has been our business name for
a few things now for years. We like it so we stick with it on all counts.
It's a play on words for us. No Bull!!

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/12/2003 5:48:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... We have an artist in town named Blue Sky. Don t know his given name, it s been Blue as long
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/12/2003 5:48:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
diamondair@... writes:


> When I've needed a name (like when sending away for free educational stuff),
> I've used--not surprisingly--Blue Sky Learning Center. :-)
> I also just entered a raffle yesterday for a cool folding mountain bike
> that
> has "Blue Sky" painted on the side. Sponsored by Blue Sky soda, now that's
> my kind of bike (hope I win!)

We have an artist in town named Blue Sky. Don't know his given name, it's
been Blue as long as I've known him (30 years?). For those of you here last
year or familiar with Columbia, he painted the "Tunnel Vision" and sculpted
the "Fire Hydrant" near the hospital where Sandra was morphined up.

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: Robin Blue Skies, The scents of success oil and money drawing oil are floating gently through the house. It s a quiet night, we are working on these things-
messages.messageBody:
Robin Blue Skies,

The scents of success oil and money drawing oil are floating gently through the house. It's a quiet night, we are working on these things- success and money....we are drawing these to us....Robin Blue Skies, I wish for you ~
the same......
Janis

From: Robin Clevenger

Sent: Monday, May 12, 2003 10:25 AM

I've used--not surprisingly--Blue Sky Learning Center. :-)
I also just entered a raffle yesterday for a cool folding mountain bike that
has "Blue Sky" painted on the side. Sponsored by Blue Sky soda, now that's
my kind of bike (hope I win!)

Blue Skies,
-Robin-

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/11/03 5:53:47 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... We have to name ours for the state for filing purposes because we are technically a private
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/11/03 5:53:47 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
KathrynJB@... writes:

> How many of you have official or unofficial homeschool names?

We have to name ours for the state for filing purposes because we are
technically a private school. Ours is "hands on homeschool." Chosen by the
boys. I thought it sounded too.......open to interpretation. Did that sound
OK I don't want to ruffle any feathers?

Pam G

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: To comply with the laws of NC on becoming a private school we thus dubbed ourselves: Train Them-Up Christian HomeSchool. Complete with, an email address, a
messages.messageBody:
To comply with the laws of NC on becoming a 'private school" we thus dubbed ourselves: "Train Them-Up" Christian HomeSchool. Complete with, an email address, a website (coming soon), letterhead and logo t-shirts (for when we take trips). Well, though not necessary, we love creating that kind of stuff. - Monica

messages.subject: Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: **How many of you have official or unofficial homeschool names?** We ve been: Harmony Flight Alternative - in CA, but then we moved back to IL where
messages.messageBody:
**How many of you have official or unofficial homeschool names?**

We've been:

Harmony Flight Alternative - in CA, but then we moved back to IL where
alternative schools are for students expelled from other schools so we became

Learning Tree Progressive Academy

and now we're the Treehouse Learning Center

Deborah in IL

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: In California if you use the Private School Affidavit (R-4) method of being legal, you must have a name for your school. Some people have fancy sounding
messages.messageBody:
In California if you use the Private School Affidavit (R-4) method of
being legal, you must have a name for your school. Some people have
fancy sounding acronyms that stand for things like Freedom and Fun for
.kid's name.Academy. Other folks use their street name, or something
else that the kids like. I hear that the use of Hogwart's had to be
sadly discouraged by numerous parents as being a definite red flag for
officialdom.



Robyn Coburn







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/11/03 5:45:20 PM, sablehs@... writes:

<< How many of you have official or unofficial homeschool names? >>

What we have actually used
Boring:
Dodd Homeschool
SCA-related:
Duckford Academy
and
Duckford Elementary (for Holly)

and what we've joked about always but never put on paper anywhere is:

Our Lady of Perpetual Vacation

messages.subject: Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: ... How many of you have official or unofficial homeschool names? Early on we ... Cove ... Cute :-) Ours is SABLE which is short for School of Academic
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, KathrynJB@a... wrote:
How many of you have official or unofficial homeschool names? Early
on we
> gave ours one, not because we had to, but just cuz. Ours is Collins
Cove
> Clothing Optional Homeschool. >>
Cute :-)
Ours is SABLE which is short for School of Academic Balanced Learned
Education {in NC we can't change our names, and i was thinking about
there future when picking it <g>}
Tracy

messages.subject: Re: Homeschool names
messages.msgSnippet: If I do, I ll just put a homeschool name on it (our current is Barking Dog Free School) and give them some subjects and grades like you listed. I figure
messages.messageBody:
If I do, I'll just put a homeschool name on it (our
current is Barking Dog Free School) and give them some subjects and
grades like you listed. I figure they'll accept what I give them.


How many of you have official or unofficial homeschool names? Early on we
gave ours one, not because we had to, but just cuz. Ours is Collins Cove
Clothing Optional Homeschool. Collins Cove because we lived across from
Collins Cove beach when we started homeschooling, and Clothing Optional
because my son tended to run around nake at the time and we thought it was
funny.

Now we live across the street from the Harmony Grove Cemetary. I suppose we
could change the name to Harmony Grove Unschool and Mortuary....

Kathryn
